headline: How to play travel tech stocks this Travel Tuesday
summary: Baird Senior Research Analyst Michael Bellisario joined Market Domination to share insights on travel technology stocks ahead of Travel Tuesday. Bellisario highlighted two standout performers in the sector: Booking Holdings (BKNG) and Expedia Group (EXPE). He characterized Booking as a "high quality" stock benefiting from strong international exposure. As for Expedia, he described it as "a self-help turnaround story," noting the company's success in overcoming minor disruptions to regain market share. "Travel trends are positive. People have jobs, people are spending money, and people are getting on airplanes," Bellisario told Yahoo Finance, emphasizing the sector's strong fundamentals. However, he also identified key risks facing these companies. The primary concerns include the potential for "a demand shock" and broader "international risk," particularly noting the current uncertainty surrounding cross-border travel. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination here. This post was written by Angel Smith

headline: 18.3M travelers to fly Thanksgiving week: TSA
summary: The 2024 Thanksgiving holiday travel season is set to break records, with the Transportation Security Administration (TSA) projecting 18.3 million passengers will take to the skies this week — a 6% increase compared to the previous year. To provide deeper insights into holiday travel trends this year, Kayak CEO Steve Hafner joins Morning Brief. Kayak is owned by Booking Holdings (BKNG). Hafner highlights the current airline market dynamics, noting strong demand for international destinations and premium seating. He also revealed promising trends for travelers, pointing out that domestic flight prices have dropped nearly 6% from last year, while international flight prices have decreased by approximately 9%. Regarding holiday travel strategies, "If you can find a plane tomorrow, please book it," Hafner emphasizes, identifying Thanksgiving Day as the most cost-effective day for air travel. Looking ahead to the broader holiday season, he predicts that airfare will decline during Christmas, providing additional opportunities for travelers seeking more affordable flights. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief here. This post was written by Angel Smith
